title: Local Rundown: Chino Valley girls' soccer falls at No. 1 Blue Ridge; Cougars' boys clinch section title
text: 10/16/2015 6:00:00 AM Local Rundown: Chino Valley girls' soccer falls at No. 1 Blue Ridge; Cougars' boys clinch section title The Daily Courier PREP SOCCERBlue Ridge 4, Chino Valley girls 1 In a battle of two top-five ranked Division V girls' soccer teams Thursday, Oct. 15, in Lakeside, defending state champion and unbeaten No. 1-rated Blue Ridge defeated No. 5 Chino Valley for the second time this season.The Cougars' setback snapped a four-match winning streak, while Blue Ridge improved to 10-0 overall.Chino Valley now has three matches left in the regular season.CVHS (7-2 overall, 3-1 in Section II) will host Grand Canyon in a section match at 6 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 17, under the lights at Chino's varsity football field. Chino Valley boys 5, Arizona College Prep 1 The two-time defending state champion and current Division V No. 1-ranked Chino Valley High boys' soccer team cruised to victory over No. 2-rated Arizona College Prep on Thursday, Oct. 15, to clinch the Section III title.Playing in Chandler, Chino Valley improved its record to 10-1 overall and 6-0 in section, while the Knights dropped to 6-2 and 3-1.Arturo Gomez had a true hat trick with three goals, and Elijah Desmond and Jordan Sanchez pitched in with a goal apiece for Chino. Arturo Gomez opened the scoring on a nice volley about 10 minutes into regulation via a well-placed assist from Fabian Gomez.Chipping in with an assist apiece were Walter Soto, Mathew Rios, Kendall Foster and Arturo Gomez.Defensively, Garrett King paced the unit with a goal-line save. Goalie Spencer Coffin was also solid, as Chino out-shot Arizona College Prep, 32-7.The Cougars, winners of nine straight matches, will conclude the regular season with their section finale at 7 p.m. Oct. 22, when they host Grand Canyon at the CVHS football stadium. PREP VOLLEYBALLBadgers sweep struggling St. Mary's squad, 3-0 PHOENIX - Erinn Marroquinn had 16 assists, 10 digs, three kills and three ace serves to lead the Prescott volleyball team to a 3-0 sweep on the road over St. Mary's on Thursday night.Alex Koehler chipped in with nine kills, Ashlynn Uvila had seven and the Badgers made quick work of the Knights, 25-13, 25-13, 25-8."It was a great team effort and a good way to go into tomorrow's tournament," Prescott head coach Shellie Bowman said.Other Prescott [19-10 Overall] standouts included Grace Hendricks with nine digs, four assists and three ace serves while Allie Jo Amos had 11 assists and five digs.Next up, the No. 8-ranked Badgers will travel south to play in the Goldwater Festival today. Their opponent schedule was not released by press time. PREP GOLFBears take second in 4-way invite at Prescott Golf & Country Club DEWEY, Ariz. - The Bradshaw Mountain golf team finished Thursday afternoon's match at the Prescott Golf & Country Club with a 13-over-par 157, which was good enough for second overall behind Sunrise Mountain's 154 [+10].Centennial finished third with a 163 [+19] and Raymond Kellis wrapped up the top four with a 197 [+53].Tanner Spohn turned in the top card for Bradshaw Mountain with a 1-over-par 37, which tied him for first overall at the event. Sunrise Mountain had two players finish the front nine with a 37 in Jake Nelson and Lorenz Blake.Other standouts for Bradshaw Mountain included Anne Transier with a 2-over-par 38 while Jacob Kidd had a 41 [+5]. Hunter Rowe finished his day with a 41 [+5] and Cole Parrish shot an 18-over-par 54.Next up, the Bears will play a four-way event hosted by cross-town rival Prescott at the Antelope Hills Golf Course on Tuesday, Oct. 20, in a make-up event that was cancelled originally due to rain on Oct. 6. Tee time is scheduled for 3:30 p.m. Courier sports reporter Brian M. Bergner Jr. contributed to this Local Rundown.
